title: Sky News launches Brexit-free news channel as Brits say they've had enough
text:

Sky News is launching a Brexit-free news channel because people are sick of hearing about it.

Research has shown Brits are switching off the news as a direct result of the constant Brexit updates that don't seem to change anything.

So Sky News decided it would launch a Brexit-free news channel instead - airing every day from 5pm to 10pm.

John Ryley, the head of Sky News, said: "Sky News Brexit-Free is a bold approach but listening to public opinion over the past weeks and months, it's something we know our viewers will find valuable."

The move is a result of research this summer by Reuters Institute that found one person in three is now avoiding the news entirely.

Of the people switching off, more than 70% said it was Brexit's fault, while 60% said the news was having a negative impact on their mood.

(Image: Wiktor Szymanowicz / Barcroft Images)

But that doesn't mean Sky will stop reporting on it - just that they are offering a chance for people to catch up on all the rest of world affairs without being reminded about it.

"Brexit is an historic story that has a major impact and we will continue to give it comprehensive coverage," Mr Ryley said.

"The new channel simply gives people the option to take a break from Brexit, apply a filter to their headlines and hear about issues away from Westminster and Brussels with a focus on hard-hitting, original journalism."

Sky News Brexit-Free will launch today at 5pm on Sky Channel 523. It will be on-air from 5pm to 10pm Monday to Friday on TV.
description: The constant, unrelenting bluster, confusion and contradiction of seemingly never-ending Brexit updates has seen people switch off from the news - so a new channel has launched
